Create a matrix of zeros.

Source: R/zeros.R
zeros.Rd

Create a matrix of zeros of size (dim1 x dim2).

zeros(dim1, dim2 = NULL)

Arguments

dim1

The dimension of the matrix (if square) or the number of rows.
dim2

The number of columns

Value

A matrix of zeros.

See also

Other MATLAB: cell, diag_matlab, feval, fileparts, isempty, ones, randn, rand, size, tic, toc

Examples


zeros(3)
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
#> [1,]    0    0    0
#> [2,]    0    0    0
#> [3,]    0    0    0
zeros(0,3)
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3]
zeros(4,7)
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4] [,5] [,6] [,7]
#> [1,]    0    0    0    0    0    0    0
#> [2,]    0    0    0    0    0    0    0
#> [3,]    0    0    0    0    0    0    0
#> [4,]    0    0    0    0    0    0    0
zeros(1,4)
#>      [,1] [,2] [,3] [,4]
#> [1,]    0    0    0    0
